snippet: A wine merchant has become a prominent name in the California wine industry, even though he doesn’t own a vineyard.
abstract: Nicole LaPorte Prototype column observes that prominent California wine merchant Cameron Hughes does not own a vineyard or a winery, but instead outsources all the labor that goes into making wine; Cameron Hughes Wine, working with wineries and vineyards, forecasts producing 300,000 cases of wine in 2012.
lead_paragraph: A wine merchant has become a prominent name in the California wine industry, even though he doesn’t own a vineyard.

headline.seo: Wine Business Bypasses the Grapevine but Enjoys Its Fruits
headline.main: Bypassing the Grape but Enjoying Its Fruits
headline.print_headline: Bypassing the Grape But Enjoying Its Fruits
